Name: Sun sensor (course)
Heritage (TRL, Technology, Availability): Available on cubesatshop, CMOS PSD detector, will fly on TechnoDemoSat-1, TRL 4-6
Science Objectives/Goals, Lifetime, Mode: Determines Sun angle vector, attitude/location, Need 6 for full sky coverage, 10 krad total dose

Name: SS-411 Two-Axis Digital Sun Sensor
Heritage (TRL, Technology, Availability): In use on 22 orbital satellites. TRL 7-9
Science Objectives/Goals, Lifetime, Mode: Determines Sun angle vector, attitude/location in 2 axes, 20 krad total dose, 16 grms random vibration, 5000 g shock

Name: MAI-101 Miniature 3 Axis Reaction Wheel
Heritage (TRL, Technology, Availability): Developed by Maryland Aerospace, sold on cubesatshop, 3 wheel assembly, reaction wheel only version of MAI-100. TRL 4-6
Science Objectives/Goals, Lifetime, Mode: Precise aiming/stability in 3 axes, Must dump angular momentum, 30 krad total dose, >12 grms

Name: MAI-100 3-Axis ADACS
Heritage (TRL, Technology, Availability): Developed by Maryland Aerospace, Contains MAI-101 Reaction wheel assembly, electromagnets, magnetometer, sun sensor, and OBC. Flight tested on QbX. TRL 7-9
Power (Further): 12 V dc @ 200 mA typical, 360 mA max
Science Objectives/Goals, Lifetime, Mode: Precise aiming/stability in 3 axes in a fully autonomouse system. Detumbling of spacecraft on release, Must dump angular momentum, 30 krad total dose, >10 grms

Name: Cubesat Magnetorque Rod (magnetic torque rod)
Heritage (TRL, Technology, Availability): Available on cubesatshop, Flight tested on BADR-B (cubesat), Fedsat, and MicroLabSat (smallsat). Scaled for cubesat system. TRL 7-9.
Science Objectives/Goals, Lifetime, Mode: attitude control in 3 axes, momentum dumping of reaction wheels, magnetic field required for attitude control. Bonded directly to PCB

Name: BCT Nano star tracker
Heritage (TRL, Technology, Availability): Available on cubesatshop, Planned flight on INSPIRE. TRL 4-6
Science Objectives/Goals, Lifetime, Mode: Detects stars as dim as 7 M, star identification. Includes >10,000 star catalog onboard, standby mode (.25 W). Lifetime > 1 yr, 2 sec attitude determination time

Name: BCT Thin-Slice Nano star tracker
Heritage (TRL, Technology, Availability): Available on cubesatshop, For volume-constrained cubesat missions. Planned flight on INSPIRE? TRL 4-6

Name: Microsat Control Moment Gyroscope
Heritage (TRL, Technology, Availability): 3 can be arranged for 3-axis control. Cubesat models available. TRL 4-6
Science Objectives/Goals, Lifetime, Mode: 10 krad (electronics)

Name: XACT Control System
Heritage (TRL, Technology, Availability): 3 torque rods, IMU, magnetometer, sun sensors, star tracker, reaction wheel assembly. TRL 4-6
Attitude Control (further): .003 deg in 2 axes, .007 deg in 3d axis.
Torque (Actuators) /FOV (sensors): Can rotate 8 kg cubesat at more than 10 deg/s
Science Objectives/Goals, Lifetime, Mode: Precise attitude determination/control in 3 axes, lifetime > 1 yr. Standby mode (.85 W)

Name: MAI-400 ACS
Heritage (TRL, Technology, Availability): Available on cubesatshop, 3 reaction wheels, magnetometer, 2-camera Earth sensor, 3 torque rods, and on-board comp. A la cart part options. Not yet flown. TRL 4-6
Mass (Further): 694 g (older version 907 g, but flight tested)
Attitude Control (further): Magnetometer +- 30000 nT, sun sensor +- 1 deg, Earth sensor +-.2 deg
Torque (Actuators) /FOV (sensors): Max torque .625 mNm and addition magnetic moment arm .15 Am^2
Science Objectives/Goals, Lifetime, Mode: Attitude determination and control, multiple uses for parts

Name: SGR-05U-Space GPS Receiver
Heritage (TRL, Technology, Availability): Flown on 3 satellites. TRL 7-9
Attitude Control (further): Absolute position to 10 m, velocity to .15 m/s
Science Objectives/Goals, Lifetime, Mode: Orbital information (position, velocity, time), Designed for use in LEO with a patch antenna (antenna bought separately, quadrifilar antenna included), 10 krad, 90-180 s to first pitch

Name: SGR-05P-Space GPS Receiver
Heritage (TRL, Technology, Availability): More professional version of SGR-05U
Attitude Control (further): Absolute position to 10 m, velocity to .15 m/s
Science Objectives/Goals, Lifetime, Mode: Orbital information (position, velocity, time), Designed for use in LEO with a patch antenna (antenna included), 7 yrs in LEO, 10 krad, 90-180 s to first pitch

Name: Magnetometer
Heritage (TRL, Technology, Availability): 3-axis fluxgate magnetometer. Includes temp sensor. Flown on 30+ missions including Fedsat, BADR-B. TRL 7-9
Science Objectives/Goals, Lifetime, Mode: Attitude determination, magnetic field measurement, Designed for attitude sensing in LEO missions, 7 yrs in LEO

Name: MAI-SES Static Earth Sensor
Heritage (TRL, Technology, Availability): Available on cubesatshop, integrated into MAI-100/200
Attitude Control (further): dip angle: .1 deg .5 deg accuracy in 2 axes
Science Objectives/Goals, Lifetime, Mode: Designed for use in LEO, requires temp. gradient in atmosphere edge, 30 krad, 10 grms

Name: MAI-100 Miniature 3-Axis ADACS
Heritage (TRL, Technology, Availability): Contains MAI-101 Reaction wheel assembly, electromagnets, magnetometer, sun sensor, and OBC. Flight tested
Science Objectives/Goals, Lifetime, Mode: Precise attitude determination/control in 3 axes, Magnetometer only works in LEO, 30 krad, 10 grms

Name: Tri-Axial Magnetometer
Heritage (TRL, Technology, Availability): Available on cubesatship, anisotropic magnetoresistance
Science Objectives/Goals, Lifetime, Mode: detect and measure magnetic fields. Attitude determination in Earth orbit

Name: Tri-Axial Magnetometer
Heritage (TRL, Technology, Availability): anisotropic magnetoresistance. Developed with Imperial College London, 3 flights in 2011-12. TRL 7-9
Science Objectives/Goals, Lifetime, Mode: 10 krad total dose, 16g rms random vibration

Name: Helium Magnetometer
Heritage (TRL, Technology, Availability): Based on full-sized instruments (Cassini). Planned flight on INSPIRE. TRL 4-6
Science Objectives/Goals, Lifetime, Mode: detect and measure magnetic fields. Attitude determination in Earth orbit, Vector mode, Scalar mode

Name: MAGIC Magnetometer
Heritage (TRL, Technology, Availability): magnetoresistive. Planned flight on CINEMA. TRL 4-6
Power (Further): .14 W attitude mode, .42 W science mode
Torque (Actuators) /FOV (sensors): Precision 25 nT attitude mode, 2-10 nT science mode.
Science Objectives/Goals, Lifetime, Mode: detect and measure magnetic fields. Attitude determination in Earth orbit, Designed to be mounted on boom for less spacecraft interference. Orbital

Name: Smart Digital Magnetometer HMR2300
Heritage (TRL, Technology, Availability): 3-axis, flown on ESTCube, anisotropic magnetoresistive (AMR) tech, surface mounted
Science Objectives/Goals, Lifetime, Mode: detect and measure magnetic fields. Attitude determination in Earth orbit

Name: 3-Axis Magnetic Sensor Hybrid HMC2003
Heritage (TRL, Technology, Availability): hybrid of HMR 1001/1002

Name: HMC 1001/1002 Integrated Circuit Magnetometer
Heritage (TRL, Technology, Availability): Single (1001) and Dual (1002) axis magnetometers. 3 axes when used together

Name: Fine Sun Sensor
Science Objectives/Goals, Lifetime, Mode: 140 deg FOV, 20 krad total dose

Name: Space-Based GPS Receiver (Prelim)
Heritage (TRL, Technology, Availability): In development, TRL 1-3
Attitude Control (further): position accuracy <10 m, velocity accuracy <25 cm/s
Science Objectives/Goals, Lifetime, Mode: 10 krad total dose

Name: XB1 Modular Cubesat Bus
Heritage (TRL, Technology, Availability): Module includes high precision atittude control, C&DH, EPS, and communication all in one package. Many options, configurableflight software, and many propulsion and payload interfaces included. Not yet flown, TRL 4-6
Volume (further): 2 modules, each 5x10x10 cm, stackable or side by side, 100x100x100 or 50x200x100 (mm)
